body_html:
with tf.Graph().as_default() as g:
    with tf.variable_scope("fc"):
        for name in ["a","b"]:
            x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=[1], name=name)
            print(x)

The variable scope should be defined outside the for loop, otherwise you are defining two variable scopes and since they are not marked to be reused tensorflow automatically appends the second one with "_1"
body_text:
with tf.Graph().as_default() as g:
    with tf.variable_scope("fc"):
        for name in ["a","b"]:
            x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=[1], name=name)
            print(x)

The variable scope should be defined outside the for loop, otherwise you are defining two variable scopes and since they are not marked to be reused tensorflow automatically appends the second one with "_1"
body:
```
with tf.Graph().as_default() as g:
    with tf.variable_scope("fc"):
        for name in ["a","b"]:
            x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=[1], name=name)
            print(x)
```

The variable scope should be defined outside the for loop, otherwise you are defining two variable scopes and since they are not marked to be reused tensorflow automatically appends the second one with "_1"
